TopicTitle: Code blocks don't have scrollbars anymore

Articles.Content:
I use "code" blocks in forum posts all the time for version histories and the like. If you look at SpaceY as an example, the revision history is quite long. The old forum would put in scrollbars to make the length manageable in the post, but also to scroll left/right. IMHO, I don't think word-wrapping is better. Code examples (and other pre-formatted plaintext) shouldn't have wrapping.

 

Edited November 30, 2015 by NecroBones
This is impacting all of my release threads as well; would love to get vertical scrollbars back on code blocks.
Feedback noted and I agree. Post on the long list of non-critical improvements we can make.
